contentrichtext.text: {{Underlinked|date=May 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2010}} '''Mary River National Park''' is a [[national park]] about {{convert|100|km}} east of [[Darwin, Northern Territory|Darwin]] in the [[Northern Territory]], Australia.<ref name=mrnp-parksnt>{{cite web|title=Mary River National Park|url=http://www.parksandwildlife.nt.gov.au/parks/find/maryriver#.UbSKiJzTQgo|work=Parks and Wildlife Commission NT official website|publisher=[[Government of the Northern Territory{{!}}Northern Territory Government]]|accessdate=9 June 2013|date=2012}}</ref> It incorporates the following areas: * [[Alligator]] [[Lagoon]] Conservation Area * Annaburroo Delta Block Conservation Area * Boggy Springs Conservation Area * Jimmy's Creek Conservation Area * Mary River Conservation Reserve * Mary River Crossing Conservation Area * McKinlay River Conservation Area * Opium Creek Conservation Area * Point Stuart Coastal Reserve * Shady Camp Conservation Area * Stuarts Tree Historical Reserve * Swim Creek Conservation Area * Wildman River Conservation Area ''See also:'' [[Protected areas of the Northern Territory (Australia)]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nretas.nt.gov.au/national-parks-and-reserves/parks/find/maryriver Mary River National Park]{{spaced ndash}}Natural Resources, Environment, The Arts and Sport; Northern Territory Government. Accessed on 10 May 2012. {{Unreferenced|date=December 2007}} {{coord|12|08|00|S|131|17|08|E|display=title|region:AU_type:landmark_source:nlwiki}} {{National Parks of the Northern Territory}} [[Category:National parks of the Northern Territory]] {{NorthernTerritory-geo-stub}}
